info.name: FyndRX API
info.description:
Complete API collection for FyndRX e-Pharmacy Platform

**Authentication:**
- **Public Browsing Endpoints** (API key only):
  • Drug search & viewing
  • Pharmacy search & prices
  • Reviews (viewing only)
  • Forms (viewing only)
  • Recent/Top searched drugs
  • Blog posts
  • Authentication endpoints
  • Consultations (create, stats, by type)
  • Stats & Analytics (platform, search, user behavior, revenue, content, pharmacy/drug performance, real-time)

- **Authenticated Endpoints** (Bearer token required):
  • User profile & settings
  • Cart operations
  • Orders
  • Prescriptions (user-specific)
  • Consultations (full CRUD + actions)
  • Reviews (create/update/delete)
  • Favorites (drugs & pharmacies - add, remove, list, check, bulk operations)
  • Saved drugs (legacy endpoints)
  • Recently viewed (user-specific)
  • Notifications

**Setup:**
1. Set API_KEY in your .env file
2. Set the api_key variable in Postman collection
3. Login to get access_token for authenticated endpoints

**Pagination:**
Most list endpoints now support pagination with 'page' and 'per_page' query parameters. Default per_page is 15. All paginated responses follow the format:
```json
{
  "data": [...],
  "meta": {
    "current_page": 1,
    "per_page": 15,
    "total": 100,
    "last_page": 7,
    "from": 1,
    "to": 15
  }
}
```

**Stats & Analytics:**
All stats endpoints support date range filtering with 'period' parameter (today, week, month, year, last_7_days, last_30_days, last_90_days, all) or custom range with 'from' and 'to' date parameters (YYYY-MM-DD format).

**Favorites:**
Favorites endpoints allow users to save drugs and pharmacies for quick access. Drugs are stored in saved_drugs table, pharmacies are stored in user's favorite_pharmacies JSON column. Supports bulk operations for efficiency.

variable.description: API key for public endpoints (set in .env as API_KEY)

request.description: Register new user (requires OTP verification). Fields: firstname, lastname, email, phone_number, password, otp
Register test user without OTP (for testing only)
Login with email or phone number in 'login' field

query.description: Search query - can be brand name, category, product name, drug name, or UOM

request.description:
Public endpoint - requires API key. Smart hybrid search that intelligently routes users to the most relevant content (Category, Brand, or Specific Product) based on their query. Returns tiered results:

**Tier 1 (Navigational)**: Exact category/brand matches - returns redirect action
**Tier 2 (Transactional)**: Specific product matches (Drug + Brand + Form + Strength + UOM)
**Tier 3 (Informational)**: Broad matches (brands, drugs, categories)

**Response Structure:**
- `top_match`: Best match with confidence score, action (navigate/list), and target URL
- `results`: Grouped results (products, brands, generics, categories)
- `suggestions`: Search suggestions

**Examples:**
- `q=Antibiotics` → Returns category match with navigate action
- `q=Panadol` → Returns brand match with navigate action
- `q=Panadol 500mg Box of 30` → Returns specific product match
- `q=Paracetamol` → Returns drug matches with variants count

response.name: Example Response - Product Match
response.body:
{
  "query": "Panadol 500mg",
  "top_match": {
    "type": "product",
    "confidence": 0.95,
    "action": "navigate",
    "target": "/medication/55?drug=55&brand=12&form=3&strength=5&uom=8",
    "data": {
      "id": 55,
      "name": "Panadol Paracetamol 500mg Tablet - Box of 30",
      "detail": "500mg Tablet - Box of 30",
      "brand": "PANADOL",
      "brand_id": 12,
      "drug": "PARACETAMOL",
      "form": "Tablet",
      "form_id": 3,
      "strength": "500mg",
      "strength_id": 5,
      "uom": "Box of 30",
      "uom_id": 8,
      "image": "https://example.com/panadol.jpg",
      "requires_prescription": false,
      "url": "/medication/55?drug=55&brand=12&form=3&strength=5&uom=8"
    }
  },
  "results": {
    "products": [
      {
        "id": 55,
        "name": "Panadol Paracetamol 500mg Tablet - Box of 30",
        "detail": "500mg Tablet - Box of 30",
        "brand": "PANADOL",
        "brand_id": 12,
        "drug": "PARACETAMOL",
        "form": "Tablet",
        "form_id": 3,
        "strength": "500mg",
        "strength_id": 5,
        "uom": "Box of 30",
        "uom_id": 8,
        "image": "https://example.com/panadol.jpg",
        "requires_prescription": false,
        "url": "/medication/55?drug=55&brand=12&form=3&strength=5&uom=8"
      }
    ],
    "brands": [],
    "generics": [],
    "categories": []
  },
  "suggestions": [
    {
      "text": "Panadol Paracetamol 500mg Tablet - Box of 30",
      "type": "product"
    }
  ]
}

request.description: Public endpoint - requires API key. Search drugs by name or brand. Supports pagination with 'page' and 'per_page' parameters (default: 15 per page). Also accepts 'query' parameter as alias for 'q'.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get drug details by ID
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get multiple drugs by IDs

Public endpoint - requires API key. List all pharmacy drugs with pricing and availability information. Supports pagination. Response includes: id, drugId, drug_price_id, name (drug name with strength), description, price, inStock, stockQuantity, category (array), image, predefinedQuantities, brands, forms, requiresPrescription

item.name: List Pharmacy Drugs by Pharmacy ID

request.description: Public endpoint - requires API key. List drugs for a specific pharmacy. Supports pagination.
Get user's saved drugs. Supports pagination.
drugId/brandId
Public endpoint - requires API key. Returns globally recent drugs (or user-specific if authenticated). Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get top searched drugs globally. Supports pagination.
Get user's recently viewed drugs. Supports pagination. Also accepts 'limit' parameter for backward compatibility.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Search pharmacies that have specific drugs. Pass drugs as JSON string in query parameter.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get all pharmacy prices. Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get prices for a specific pharmacy. Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get prices for a specific drug across all pharmacies. Supports pagination. Optional: include_pharmacy (default: true), lat/lng for distance calculation.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get all drug forms. Supports pagination.
Add item to cart. Note: Items are automatically grouped by pharmacy_branch_id

Replaces the user's entire cart with the provided array of items. 

**Logic:**
- Clears existing cart items for the user.
- Iterates through the new items.
- For each item, it looks up the `PharmacyDrugPrice`.
- It **automatically derives** the `pharmacy_branch_id` from the price record or its parent pharmacy.
- **Strict Validation:** If a branch ID cannot be determined for an item, the sync will fail with an error to prevent 'invisible' cart items. 
- Returns the full updated cart structure (same as GET /cart).

Creates an order from the user's current cart items. 

**Modes:**
1. **Multi-Branch Checkout (Default):** Send `pharmacy_branch_id: null` (or omit it). The API will automatically split your cart into separate orders for each pharmacy branch.
2. **Single Branch Checkout:** Send a specific `pharmacy_branch_id`. The API will create an order ONLY for that branch. If your cart contains items from other branches, those items will remain in the cart (unlike the previous behavior which caused an error).

**Process:**
- Validates request.
- Groups cart items by branch (if multi-branch).
- Creates Order(s).
- Clears processed items from the cart.
- Returns an array of orders (if multi-branch) or a single order object.
Upload prescription file (pdf, jpg, jpeg, png, max 5MB)

Public endpoint - requires API key (X-API-Key header)
Add a drug to a prescription using Pharmacy Price ID.
Bulk add drugs to a prescription.
Bulk update drugs in a prescription.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get reviews. type can be 'drug' or 'pharmacy' (also accepts 'medication' for backward compatibility)
reviewable_type can be 'drug' or 'pharmacy' (also accepts 'medication' for backward compatibility). images is optional array of image URLs (max 5)
Mark review as helpful (true) or not helpful (false)
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get review statistics. type can be 'drug' or 'pharmacy' (also accepts 'medication' for backward compatibility)
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get all blog posts. Supports pagination with 'per_page' (default: 15) or 'limit' for backward compatibility. Optional filters: category, tag, search, sort_by.
Get related blog posts. Supports pagination.
Get comments for a blog post. Supports pagination.
Public endpoint - requires API key (X-API-Key header)
Get user's notifications. Supports pagination (default: 20 per page).
Get notifications by type. Supports pagination (default: 20 per page).

}

request.description:
Public endpoint - requires API key. Create a new consultation.

**Required Fields:**
- `subject` (string, max:255) - Consultation subject/title

**Optional Fields:**
- `consultation_type` (string) - Type of consultation. Options: `general`, `medication_review`, `chronic_disease`, `acute_illness`, `wellness`, `vaccination`. Default: `general`
- `symptoms` (string) - Description of symptoms
- `medical_history` (string) - Patient's medical history
- `current_medications` (string) - Current medications being taken
- `allergies` (string) - Known allergies
- `consultation_notes` (string) - Additional notes about the consultation
- `priority` (string) - Priority level. Options: `low`, `normal`, `high`, `urgent`. Default: `normal`
- `user_id` (integer) - ID of registered user to assign consultation to (must exist in users table). If provided, patient info will be auto-filled from user profile if not explicitly provided.
- `patient_name` (string, max:255) - Patient's full name (auto-filled if user_id provided or user is authenticated)
- `patient_email` (email, max:255) - Patient's email address (auto-filled if user_id provided or user is authenticated)
- `patient_phone` (string, max:20) - Patient's phone number (auto-filled if user_id provided or user is authenticated)
- `patient_date_of_birth` (date) - Patient's date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- `patient_gender` (string) - Patient's gender. Options: `male`, `female`
- `pharmacy_id` (integer) - ID of the pharmacy (must exist in pharmacies table)
- `pharmacy_branch_id` (integer) - ID of the pharmacy branch (must exist in pharmacy_branches table)
- `scheduled_at` (datetime) - Scheduled date/time for the consultation (ISO 8601 format, must be in the future)
- `source` (string) - Source of consultation. Options: `web`, `mobile_app`, `phone`, `walk_in`. Default: `web`
- `attachments` (array of files) - File attachments (jpeg, png, jpg, pdf, doc, docx, max 5MB each). Note: For file uploads, use `multipart/form-data` instead of JSON.

**Note:** 
- If `user_id` is provided, patient info (`patient_name`, `patient_email`, `patient_phone`) will be auto-filled from that user's profile if not explicitly provided.
- If user is authenticated (Bearer token) and `user_id` is not provided, the authenticated user's ID will be set automatically and patient info will be auto-filled from the authenticated user's profile if not provided.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get consultation statistics. Returns total, pending, in_review, responded, completed, cancelled, requires_followup, average_rating, and total_rated counts.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get consultations by type. Types: general, medication_review, chronic_disease, acute_illness, wellness, vaccination. Supports pagination.

query.description: Filter by status: pending, in_review, responded, completed, cancelled
Filter by priority: low, normal, high, urgent
Filter by type: general, medication_review, chronic_disease, acute_illness, wellness, vaccination
Search in consultation_number, subject, patient_name, patient_email, patient_phone

request.description: Get user's consultations with advanced filtering and search. Supports pagination. Returns consultations for authenticated user only.
Get detailed information about a specific consultation. User can only view their own consultations.

request.description: Pharmacist response to a consultation. Marks consultation as responded and tracks response time. Requires pharmacist authentication.
Mark consultation as completed. Sets completed_at timestamp. completion_notes is optional.
Cancel a consultation. Sets status to cancelled and records cancellation timestamp.
Rate a consultation (1-5 stars) and provide feedback. Rating is required, feedback is optional.

Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) - used with custom period
End date (YYYY-MM-DD) - used with custom period

request.description: Public endpoint - requires API key. Get comprehensive platform statistics including users, orders, drugs, pharmacies, revenue, engagement, content, and consultations. Supports date range filtering.

Public endpoint - requires API key. Get search analytics including total searches, unique drugs/users searched, top searched drugs, trending drugs, search trends, recent searches, and searches by category.

Public endpoint - requires API key. Get user behavior and engagement statistics including total/active/new/returning users, engagement metrics (views, unique drugs viewed), activity metrics (orders, prescriptions, consultations, reviews), and user growth trends.

Public endpoint - requires API key. Get revenue and financial statistics including total revenue, average order value, revenue by status, by payment method, by delivery method, revenue trends, and top pharmacies by revenue.

Public endpoint - requires API key. Get content statistics including blog posts (total, published, views, likes, comments, top posts) and reviews (total, approved, average rating, rating distribution, verified purchases).

query.description: Optional: Filter by specific pharmacy ID

request.description: Public endpoint - requires API key. Get pharmacy performance statistics including total orders, revenue, average order value, completion rate, orders by status, and top performing pharmacies.
Public endpoint - requires API key. Get drug performance statistics including most searched, most viewed, most ordered, most reviewed drugs, and trending drugs.

Public endpoint - requires API key. Get real-time statistics for the last 24 hours including orders (new, completed, revenue), users (new registrations, active), searches (total, unique drugs), views (total, unique drugs), and consultations (new, responded).
Get user's payment transactions. Supports pagination.
Webhook endpoint for payment gateway (no auth)
Get all user favorites (drugs and pharmacies). Returns paginated results for both types.
Get count of favorite drugs and pharmacies.
Get user's favorite drugs with full drug details including brands, forms, and categories.
Get user's favorite pharmacies with full pharmacy details.
Add a drug to favorites. brand_id, form_id, strength_id, and qty are optional.
